documentation.xhtml: set this flag to write FB input values to the TcComObject's input DataAreas. This will overwrite the mapped input values before module execution. Set to FALSE to read the mapped input values from the TcComObject to the FB.
process image src and dst pointers and sizes
hResult of interface calls (0 if no error)
flag indicating whether the module instance was created dynamically
the object state at the time FB_init was called, FB_exit will try to switch to this state (only if this means to shift down)

ST.xhtml: FB_init := SUCCEEDED(Init(oid));

IF (SUCCEEDED(hr)) THEN IF (ipTcComObj=0) THEN hr := Tc2_System.E_HRESULTAdsErr.NOINTERFACE; ELSIF (pipItf^=ULINT_TO_DWORD(pNull)) THEN hr := ipTcComObj.TcQueryInterface(iid:= iid, pipItf:=pipItf); END_IF END_IF
hResult := S_OK;
assignedClsId := clsId; bClassIdVerified := false;

InterfaceAsPlainText.xhtml: METHOD PUBLIC AssignClassId VAR_INPUT clsId : CLSID; END_VAR

ST.xhtml: Error := FAILED(hResult);
THIS^.nDataAreas := nDataAreas; THIS^.pDataAreas := pDataAreas;
this^.pInitData := pInitData;

InterfaceAsPlainText.xhtml: METHOD PUBLIC SetInitDataInfo VAR_INPUT pInitData : POINTER TO TComInitDataHdr; END_VAR

ST.xhtml: hResult := ReadModuleClassId(); ClassId := moduleClsId;
SetObjState(State);
ErrorCode := hResult;

documentation.xhtml: if TRUE, the retain variables are initialized (warm start / cold start)
if TRUE, the instance afterwards gets moved into the copy code (online change)

ST.xhtml: stInitData := InitData;
InitData := stInitData;
